name: Mexican Hat Lodge and Swingin Steak

reviews.text: This is one of only 3 places to stay, which is ideally located for monument valley.
reviews.title: Really individual!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place may not have the best accommodation (bright orange walls in bedroom?), but it has great character and of course the swinging steak.
reviews.title: Best Steaks in the West (and East!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food price is inflated and as far as steaks go iin the US it was pretty average (equivalent to a really good uk steak).
reviews.title: Oddly Appealing

reviews.text: You can sit outside with an open fire and the barbcue steaks cooking watching the sun set. Fantastic.
reviews.title: nice place after sunset in monument valley, steaks are ok but overpriced.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Advertised on the food network; Anything good enough for Alton Brown is good enough for me! Steak was really good, beans, salad & toast with some good cold beer! This little spot is out in the middle of nowhere, just by Monument Valley so there is a lot to see.
reviews.title: Funky and Fun

likes.disliked: — The sloping floor we mentioned in the review. Also outdoor corridors/access might be dicey in cold weather.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK, the property is old, the rooms are small, the bathroom is sort of clunky: but if you want The Wynn, go to Vegas. If however you want a sample of what life might have been like in Cowboy country a few generations back, this is the place for you. The room is very small, but clean enough. The deep orange decor makes for a dim light, but has an authentic Mexican border feel. And make no mistake: this place is HOT. The reception from the proprietor was reserved, but he came into his own later that evening.
reviews.title: Eccentricity at its very best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you get the chance to do so, make sure to drive into the town using the Moki Dugway - it's perfectly manageable in an ordinary 2WD car, and the view is spectacular. The town itself is just a few miles north of Monument Valley, so you can get a really good look at John Ford/Wayne film country, have a drive around, see the Mittens, buy some relatively highly priced trinkets from the indian culture stalls, drive the first few hundred yards of the (very) rough 20 mile drive through the floor of the valley and then turn back totally unnerved: and still get back in time for dinner - which is when the fun starts.
reviews.title: Great, unique place

likes.liked: — The unique atmosphere, cleanliness, and great steak

reviews.text: The barbecue has a giant swinging griddle, so you get to see your own steak passing through the flames 60 times per minute. A very simple but effective menu of steak, salad, beans & texas toast, washed down with cold beer. After a long day working hard on soaking up the scenery, this is just about as good as it gets: but wait, there's more - the outhouse opens up to reveal a small country and western stage, onto which a singer/gee-tarist strolls, and our hotel proprietor ambles on and plays backing guitar.
reviews.title: Run down but Clean and comfortable

likes.disliked: — No mobile phone or internet coverage

reviews.title: What a good steak !!!
reviews.text: In the mental catalogue of great evenings, this makes the top 10. In the words of another film icon - I'll Be Back.

Wow, how do I begin? When we were staying in Moab, Utah, at a luxury B & B, we were having a great conversation with a nice lady from New York City. She asked about our itinerary, and when I got to our stay in Mexican Hat, she just looked at me, bewildered, and said, "You're staying in Mexican Hat? Mexican Hat? There's nothing there!!" Well, I worried about her comment for over a week, and was ready to cancel our reservation several times. Even when we drove up to the motel, I told my husband, "I'll just call and cancel." But we decided if we really didn't like the room, etc., then we would go on down the road.
reviews.title: This is what Heaven looks like

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to stay at the Mexican Hat Lodge because of reviews we read . The outside of the building is run down with clutter around. Our room was upstairs and at the back. The room was small with patch on the walls that hadn't been painted. It was clean but the carpet and accessories looked very old and run down. However, the bathroom looked new. It was too run down for me to feel comfortable so we didn't stay. There may be other rooms that are nicer.
reviews.title: Our experience left a lot to be desired.

reviews.text: Quiet and clean room, not so large. Great location next to the monument valley.
reviews.title: Convenient location in the Monument Valley
Swinging Steak not up to par
Best steaks in Utah???
reviews.text: We didn't try the barbeque so i cant say anything about it.

aka: Mexican Hat Lodge And Swingin Steak Hotel
